objects.definition: An electrical device that converts electric power into radio waves and vice versa.
objects.name: Antenna

objects.definition: A survey level that makes use of a compensator that ensures the line of sight remains horizontal once the operator has roughly leveled the instrument.
objects.name: Automatic level
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levelling

objects.definition: A device consisting of one or more electrochemical cells that convert stored chemical energy into electrical energy.
objects.name: Battery

objects.definition: Two or more wires running side by side and bonded, twisted, or braided together to form a single assembly.
objects.name: Cable
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cable

objects.definition: A device used to create photographic images
objects.name: Camera

objects.definition: An electroinic device that limits the rate at which electric current is added to or drawn from electric batteries.
objects.name: Charge regulator

objects.definition: An electronic device that records data over time or in relation to location either with a built in instrument or sensor or via external instruments and sensors.
objects.name: Datalogger
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_logger

objects.definition: A generic electronic device
objects.name: Electronic device

objects.definition: A cabinet or box within which electrical or electronic equipment are mounted to protect them from the environment.
objects.name: Enclosure

objects.definition: A device used to measure paramters of flouroescence, including its intensity and wavelength distribution of emission spectrum after excitation by a certain spectrum of light.
objects.name: Fluorometer
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fluorometer

objects.definition: A device that accurately calculates geographical location by receiving information from Global Positioning System satellites.
objects.name: Global positioning system receiver

objects.definition: A device used to couple multiple other devices.
objects.name: Interface

objects.definition: Any type of equipment, apparatus or device designed, constructed and refined to use well proven physical principles, relationships or technology to facilitate or enable the pursuit, acquisition, transduction and storage of repeatable, verifiable data, usually consisting of sets numerical measurements made upon otherwise unknown, unproven quantities, properties, phenomena, materials, forces or etc.
objects.name: Laboratory instrument

objects.definition: A graduate wooden, fiberglass, or aluminum rod used to determine differences in elevation.
objects.name: Level staff
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Level_staff

objects.definition: A pole that supports sensors, instruments, or measurement peripherals.
objects.name: Mast

objects.definition: A free standing tower that supports measuring instruments or sensors.
objects.name: Measurement tower

objects.definition: A device that selects one of several analog or digital input signals and forwards the selected input into a single line.
objects.name: Multiplexer

objects.definition: An electronic device that supplies electric energy to an electrical load. The primary function of a power supply is to convert one form of electrical energy to another (e.g., solar to chemical).
objects.name: Power supply
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Power_supply

objects.definition: A sensor that measures pressure, typically of gases or liquids.
objects.name: Pressure transducer

objects.definition: A device that transfers information via electromagnetic signals through the atmosphere or free space.
objects.name: Radio
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radio

objects.definition: A device used to collect specimens for later ex situ analysis.
objects.name: Sampler

objects.definition: A device that detects events or changes in quantities and provides a corresponding output, generally as an electrical or optical signal.
objects.name: Sensor
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sensor

objects.definition: A photovoltaic module that is electrically connected and mounted on a supporting structure.  Used to generate and supply electricity.
objects.name: Solar panel
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solar_panel

objects.definition: An enclosure used to protect electronic equipment used for stormwater sampling.
objects.name: Storm box

objects.definition: An electronic and optical instrument used in modern surveying and building construction.  A total station is an electronic theodoloite integrated with an electronic distance meter to read slope distances from the instrument to a particular point.
objects.name: Total station

objects.definition: A portable, three-legged frame used as a platform for supporting the weight and maintaining the stability of some other object. Typically used as a data collection platform to which sensors are attached.
objects.name: Tripod
objects.provenance: Definition adapted from Wikipedia. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tripod

objects.definition: A water quality sensor that monitors light reflected off the particles suspended in water.
objects.name: Turbidimeter

objects.definition: A water quality monitoring instrument having multiple attached sensors.
objects.name: Water quality sonde
